Hi Everyone,

Something we are trying to work out and would be very appreciative of any information to help tackle this issue:

*Problem:*
So we have a site that is using HubSpot Forms on a WordPress site which works great.
What we are trying to add is the HubSpot Cookie banner embed which we have set up in HubSpot and then added the embed code to our WordPress Site.

 The issue is that we are trying to give the user full control over the settings so we have enabled the Cookie Settings Button which is also handled in HubSpot, however when we embed it the button doesn't work, and we are also wondering how to link this to GTM (Google Tag Manager) so that if a user declines then it removes this GTM tracking cookie.

Any resource or advice on how to tackle this would be very appreciated. :male-technologist:

> What we are trying to add is the HubSpot Cookie banner embed which we have set up in HubSpot and then added the embed code to our WordPress Site
You shouldn’t have had an additional embed code if you have HubSpot’s tracking link on your website which includes the banner, chat widget, etc.

You would just want to install the HubSpot tracking code <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/reports/install-the-HubSpot-tracking-code?_ga=2.186813352.1849390097.1664208279-858424222.1660048049#:~:text=Install%20the%20tracking%20code%20using%20Google%20Tag%20Manager|via GTM> and then ensure the cookie code fires first. But also — the HubSpot cookie banner only controls cookies placed by HubSpot, so you will want to make sure that you have linked social media pixels and tracking through HubSpot and not through GTM or it will not impact those.
Thanks for the info will implement this and test it out. Appreciate the help

Hi there. I’ve got a question I can’t find an answer to, or the answer is just that this is not possible with HS-CMS…

In planning a transition from our current website infrastructure (WordPress) to a new infrastructure and/or CMS, we need to be able to plan a migration path for our software licensing and download system. For a period of time, we would need the ability to accept a get request to the server at our custom domain (e.g. <http://example.com|example.com> possibly hosted with HubSpot) and at a minimum respond to that request with a static response; or ideally process a few variables from that get request and have a simple response to that request based on what file our customers need...

Here is an example of a request:

<https://example.com/?pu_request_plugin={plugin-slug}&pu_plugin_api={user-api}&pue_active_version={testing-install-version}&pu_checking_for_updates=1&site_domain={domainofuserwithoutprotocol}>

Responding to that type of get request with a dynamic or even static JSON object response would allow us to transition people from getting updates at our main website that is managed by a new CMS/HubSpot to managed at subdomain that we manage. Over time the requests to the main domain for this purpose would tail off to zero.

Can anyone help me know what we can do in that situation?
